result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Kevin Walton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  On motion of the state, Court ordered Ct.'s #1 & #2: DISMISSED, but to be read in for the purpose of sentencing. jks
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.
JUSTICEPOINT Pretrial services Report filed. jks

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant John Kevin Walton not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. These are new cases for the defendant.  Cases are previously set in Branch 46.  Defense request these be set on the same day for plea and sentencing. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: EDGAR C; MARQUESSA Y.; 2455 W WISCONSIN AVE, MILW.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Kevin Walton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John Kevin Walton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
